meanings.definition: An increase in speed or rate of progress.
meanings.sent1: The speedup of the car was impressive as it zoomed down the road.
meanings.sent2: The speedup of the internet connection made browsing much faster.
meanings.sent3: The speedup of the turtle crossing the finish line was unexpected.
meanings.sent4: The speedup of time during a thrilling movie makes it fly by.
meanings.sent5: The speedup of the assembly line improved productivity significantly.

meanings.definition: The act of making something go faster.
meanings.sent1: She applied a speedup to the treadmill to challenge herself.
meanings.sent2: The speedup of the train allowed it to arrive at the station early.
meanings.sent3: The speedup of the snail's pace was comical to watch.
meanings.sent4: The speedup of the river's flow after the rain was noticeable.
meanings.sent5: The speedup of the computer's processing was due to the new software update.

meanings.definition: To accelerate or quicken the pace of something.
meanings.sent1: He decided to speedup the project to meet the deadline.
meanings.sent2: The chef needed to speedup the cooking process to serve the meal on time.
meanings.sent3: She tried to speedup her speech during the presentation but stumbled over her words.
meanings.sent4: The wind seemed to speedup as the storm approached.
meanings.sent5: The coach encouraged the team to speedup their running pace during practice.
